sen.j: 九条政基（くじょうまさもと、文安2年5月7日 (旧暦)（1445年6月12日） - 永正13年4月4日 (旧暦)（1516年5月5日））は、室町時代末期から戦国時代 (日本)初期の公家・関白。
sen.e: Masamoto KUJO (June 12th in 1445) - May 5th in 1516) is a Kuge (court noble) and Kanpaku (chief adviser to the Emperor) from the end of the Muromachi Period to the beginning of the Period of Civil Wars (Japan).

sen.e: When the Onin War broke out in 1467, Masamoto who was in center of the Kuge (court nobles) society unexpectedly became a living witness to the fall of the Kuge class following the war.

sen.j: 乱中は坂本 (大津市)に避難していたが、公事用途200貫文を執事（家司）であり母方の従兄弟でもある唐橋在数に立て替えてもらい、その借銭の棒引きの条件として、文明4年、残り少ない家領のなかから日根野荘入山田村年貢を息子尚経の代まで在数に引き渡す羽目になった。
sen.e: During the War, he evacuated to Sakamoto (Otsu-city), and got Arikazu KARAHASHI who was his clerk (Keishi (household superintendent)) and cousin on his mother's side to cover 200 hiki for official matters, but in 1470, as a condition for being forgiven his debt, he ended up handing over Arikazu the nengu (land tax) of Iriyamada-mura, Hineno-sho from the little remaining territory he had until the generation of his son Hisatsune.

sen.j: 政基と在数の対立は、九条家経済が破綻状態だっただけに以後も長く続き、ついに明応5年（1496年）正月、政基・尚経父子は自邸において在数を殺害した。
sen.e: The conflict between Masamoto and Arikazu lasted long afterwards, because the economy of the Kujo family was in a state of collapse, and eventually at New Year in 1496 Masamoto and his son Hisatsune killed Arikazu at their own house.

sen.j: 公家社会もこの異常な事件の対応に苦慮したが、結局は太政大臣一条冬良の意見を採用し、政基父子を勅勘処分として出仕を停止することに決定した。
sen.e: The court noble society was also at a loss over how to cope with this unusual incident, but it ended up adopting the opinion of Daijo-daijin (Grand minister of state) Fuyuyoshi ICHIJO, deciding that Masamoto and his son would be dismissed by the Emperor and their attendance at court would be stopped.
